title: 112_hr6659
content: The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" is cited as the short title. It extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds for certain cities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends the Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds by treating economic development extension bonds as qualified bonds issued before January 1, 2011. Interest on these bonds is includible in gross income, with a 45 percent subsidy rate. An economic development extension bond is defined as a specified bond issued within a 1-year period with certain criteria met. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds by treating economic development extension bonds as qualified bonds issued before January 1, 2011. Specified bonds are defined as obligations where interest would be excludable from gross income under section 103. The "Urban Recovery and Growth Act" extends Recovery Zone Economic Development Bonds by applying rules similar to section 54AA(d)(2) and excluding section 148 for certain qualified purposes, including economic development and refinancing of specified city debt. The term 'specified city' refers to a principal city with high unemployment and population loss. The maximum amount of bonds designated for a specified city is limited. The maximum bond limitation for a specified city is determined based on its population proportion to the total population of all specified cities. Extension of recovery zone economic development bonds for certain cities, effective for obligations issued after the enactment of this Act.
